brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts how external factors such as message format and re-addressing can affect communication.

Format - A message starts as a phone call, is written down, and then is read out load. Information that has to be recoded and decoded a number of times might not be transmitted successfully.

Re-addressing - A letter goes from location to location, with many postal forwarding marks on it, and finally goes into a trash can. Messages that have to be readdressed and redirected a number of times might not be delivered successfully.
